newsitem.title: FRANCE: Temperatures hit records in Algerian Sahara.
newsitem.headline: Temperatures hit records in Algerian Sahara.

text.p: Temperatures in the Tidikelt area of Algeria's Sahara Desert have hit records of more than 48 degrees Celsius (over 118 degrees Fahrenheit) in the shade during the day, Algeria's official news agency APS said on Tuesday.
Even at night, the average has been 34 to 36 degrees (93 to 97 degrees Fahrenheit), it said, adding that fans, air conditioners and humidiers could not cope with the heat.
The agency said there was also a shortage of drinking water caused by the main water distribution firm, which is in financial difficulties, having its power cut off for non-payment of bills.
The main town in Tidikelt region is In Salah, some 550 km (345 miles) north of Algeria's main southern town of Tamanrasset.
